No quick fix for analyst conflicts By MATHEW INGRAM Globe and Mail Update Friday, November 1 – Online Edition, Posted at 3:48 PM EST
As if awakening from a dream, investors have realized with a shock in the past year or so that research reports written by Wall Street analysts — and, let's face it, Bay Street ones as well — are not always the scrupulously objective insights they might have hoped for. In many cases, they are closer to marketing brochures than research, something professional money managers have been more aware of than the average investor.
일반 투자가들은 월스트리트지의 (주식시장)분석보고서가 - 솔직히 말해 (캐나다의)베이 스트리트 것들도- 시종일관 철저한 정직과 통찰력에 근거한 자료와는 동 떨어진 (주식판매용) 선전 팜플렛에 지나지 않았음에 놀라했으나 이 사실은 투자전문가들에겐 생소한 것이 아니었다.
야후사전... scru·pu·lous － adj.
1 양심적인, 신중한(conscientious), 지조 있는(principled). ㆍ with ∼ honesty 성실하고 정직한 태도로. 2 세심한, 꼼꼼한(punctilious), 면밀한, (…에) 용의 주도한, 빈틈없는(precise, thorough) <in, about ‥>. ㆍ be ∼ in money matters[one's attire] 금전 문제[복장]에 대해 빈틈이 없다. ㆍ be ∼ about doing things 매사를 꼼꼼하게 하다. ▷ ∼·ly adv
Cambridge Dictionary scrupulous (지극히 양심적인) adjective extremely honest, or doing everything correctly and exactly as it should be done A scrupulous politician would not lie about her business interests. The nurse told him to be scrupulous (=extremely careful) about keeping the wound clean.
scrupulously adverb She is always scrupulously honest/fair. They have scrupulously avoided being seen in public together. A hospital must be kept scrupulously clean.
